trans-unit.source: Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations
trans-unit.target: Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations

trans-unit.source: Several Blob service operations support the use of conditional headers.
trans-unit.target: Several Blob service operations support the use of conditional headers.

trans-unit.source: You can specify conditional headers to carry out an operation only if a specified condition has been met.
trans-unit.target: You can specify conditional headers to carry out an operation only if a specified condition has been met.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service follows the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink> for conditional headers.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service follows the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink> for conditional headers.

trans-unit.source: The supported conditional headers are described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: The supported conditional headers are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: For versions 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag can be specified in quotes.
trans-unit.target: For versions 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag can be specified in quotes.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).
trans-unit.target: An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag does not match the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag does not match the value specified.

trans-unit.source: For versions 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag can be specified in quotes.
trans-unit.target: For versions 2011-08-18 and newer, the ETag can be specified in quotes.

trans-unit.source: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the resource does not exist, and fail the operation if it does exist.
trans-unit.target: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the resource does not exist, and fail the operation if it does exist.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Read Operations in Version 2013-08-15 or Later
trans-unit.target: Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Read Operations in Version 2013-08-15 or Later

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, the <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties (REST API)</link> operations support multiple conditional headers.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, the <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties (REST API)</link> operations support multiple conditional headers.

trans-unit.source: You can specify any combination of supported conditional headers.
trans-unit.target: You can specify any combination of supported conditional headers.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service will evaluate these conditions according to following expression:
trans-unit.target: The Blob service will evaluate these conditions according to following expression:

trans-unit.source: You can also provide multiple comma-separated values for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide multiple comma-separated values for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If you specify multiple values for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, then the Blob service performs a logical <languageKeyword>OR</languageKeyword> operation on all of the provided values before evaluating the entire expression.
trans-unit.target: If you specify multiple values for <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, then the Blob service performs a logical <languageKeyword>OR</languageKeyword> operation on all of the provided values before evaluating the entire expression.

trans-unit.source: If you specify multiple values for <parameterReference>if-None-Match</parameterReference>, then the service performs a logical <languageKeyword>AND</languageKeyword> operation before evaluating the entire expression.
trans-unit.target: If you specify multiple values for <parameterReference>if-None-Match</parameterReference>, then the service performs a logical <languageKeyword>AND</languageKeyword> operation before evaluating the entire expression.

trans-unit.source: Specifying multiple values for <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> is not supported and results in error code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: Specifying multiple values for <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> is not supported and results in error code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: This feature is enabled in order to comply with <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html</linkUri></externalLink> and to cater to scenarios where a Content Delivery Network (CDN) or proxy server adds additional conditional headers to an inflight request.
trans-unit.target: This feature is enabled in order to comply with <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html</linkUri></externalLink> and to cater to scenarios where a Content Delivery Network (CDN) or proxy server adds additional conditional headers to an inflight request.

trans-unit.source: Below are some examples of different combinations of conditional headers.
trans-unit.target: Below are some examples of different combinations of conditional headers.

trans-unit.source: Consider a <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> request containing the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: Consider a <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> request containing the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the result if the headers are evaluated individually, and the result if they are evaluated in combination.
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the result if the headers are evaluated individually, and the result if they are evaluated in combination.

trans-unit.source: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: Consider a request containing <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Conditional Headers for Read Operations in Versions Prior to 2013-08-15, and for Write Operations (All Versions)
trans-unit.target: Specifying Conditional Headers for Read Operations in Versions Prior to 2013-08-15, and for Write Operations (All Versions)

trans-unit.source: When calling Blob service read operations (<link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties (REST API)</link>) with versions prior to 2013-08-15, and when calling any write operation regardless of version, keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: When calling Blob service read operations (<link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties (REST API)</link>) with versions prior to 2013-08-15, and when calling any write operation regardless of version, keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.
trans-unit.target: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.

trans-unit.source: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: If a response includes an ETag, verify the version of the request and response before processing the ETag.
trans-unit.target: If a response includes an ETag, verify the version of the request and response before processing the ETag.

trans-unit.source: For example, version 2011-08-18 and later return a quoted ETag, but older versions do not.
trans-unit.target: For example, version 2011-08-18 and later return a quoted ETag, but older versions do not.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your application can process both ETag formats before they are evaluated.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your application can process both ETag formats before they are evaluated.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>RFC 2616</linkText><linkUri>http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt</linkUri></externalLink> allows multiple ETag values in a single header, but requests to the Blob service can only include one ETag value.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>RFC 2616</linkText><linkUri>http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt</linkUri></externalLink> allows multiple ETag values in a single header, but requests to the Blob service can only include one ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specifying more than one ETag value results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: Specifying more than one ETag value results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.target: The operations that support conditional headers are described in the following table.

trans-unit.target: For conditions on the destination blob:

trans-unit.target: The following Blob service data operations do not currently support conditional headers:

trans-unit.source: HTTP Response Codes for Operations Supporting Conditional Headers
trans-unit.target: HTTP Response Codes for Operations Supporting Conditional Headers

trans-unit.source: If the request includes a conditional header and the specified condition is not met by the resource being requested, the Blob service returns an HTTP response code.
trans-unit.target: If the request includes a conditional header and the specified condition is not met by the resource being requested, the Blob service returns an HTTP response code.

trans-unit.source: The response codes returned are in accordance with the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification (RFC 2616).
trans-unit.target: The response codes returned are in accordance with the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification (RFC 2616).

trans-unit.source: Methods in the Azure .NET client library convert these error response codes into a <codeEntityReference autoUpgrade="true" qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.StorageException</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Methods in the Azure .NET client library convert these error response codes into a <codeEntityReference autoUpgrade="true" qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.StorageException</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a read operation.
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a read operation.

trans-unit.source: Read operations use the verbs GET or HEAD.
trans-unit.target: Read operations use the verbs GET or HEAD.

trans-unit.source: Response code if condition has not been met
trans-unit.target: Response code if condition has not been met

trans-unit.source: Refer to the examples above for results when using multiple headers with versions 2013-08-15 or later.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the examples above for results when using multiple headers with versions 2013-08-15 or later.

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a write operation.
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a write operation.

trans-unit.source: Write operations use the verbs PUT or DELETE.
trans-unit.target: Write operations use the verbs PUT or DELETE.

trans-unit.source: Response code if condition has not been met
trans-unit.target: Response code if condition has not been met

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header when the operation is a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: The <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation uses the verbs PUT.
trans-unit.target: The <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation uses the verbs PUT.

trans-unit.source: Response code if condition has not been met
trans-unit.target: Response code if condition has not been met
